title: Lot of "invalid URL scheme, want \"enode\"" entries in geth.log
body:
### Description

*Type*: Bug

*Summary*: After using an app for 1 day log  is 1-2 Mb and contains many `value=[] error="invalid URL scheme, want \"enode\""` (~8 000 entries and 15 000 in logs). 

Here is the log: [geth (21).log](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/files/2105318/geth.21.log)

#### Expected behavior
The error does not occur or geth.log does not contain so many entries with the error. 

#### Actual behavior
geth.log is spammed with the error

### Reproduction

See comment below

### Additional Information
* Status version: nighlty, June 15
* Operating System: Android, iOS
actually, it happened for me on release build https://jenkins.status.im/job/status-react/job/release/job/release%252F0.9.20/2/, not on nightly build

Steps to reproduce:
on Android devices A and B:
1. Install app on device A and B. Create account, Share Data. Do not change anything else. Bottnodes will be disabled by default, do not change this.
2. Launch app on both devices, add device B to the contacts of device A.
3. as A: send text message to B, e.g. "Ok"
4. as B: send text message to A, e.g "fine"
5. as A: close app
6. as A: launch app and sign in. Check geth log


Content of geth.log on Device A after the steps to reproduce:

I'm removing "release" label since it's not a blocker for upcoming release (0.9.22).
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
